TopicTitle: What do you like to know most about vessels in KSP when looking at other people's stuff?

Articles.Content:
If you know of the KSA, then you know we have a pretty robust Flight Tracker. With KSP v1.1 still in development I have free time to make it better and better while waiting for the new KSP release. I've personally run out of things to add that I feel would be helpful to people coming to learn about a vessel and what it is currently doing and what it plans to do and even what it has already done.

So now I turn to the community and ask - what sort of information do you like to know about a vessel when viewing it externally? (not your vessel in your game)
Cost/value, maybe? How much would I get for the vessel if I recovered it on the launchpad right now? Is it worth sending a mission to bring it home?
Probably its capabilities most, how much it can do and how efficient/quickly it gets done.
Maybe also resources and KIS/KAS storing capacities? (If relevant)
I like to know the design tricks, both of functional and aesthetic nature.
Designer, DV, TWR, active engine type, part count, mass, and destination.
I phrased my question poorly, but these responses still are useful for making blueprints & craft infographics. I'll come back another time with a better way of asking for what I'm looking for

DV budget, tech level, pad size and mass/ part count, cost per tonne of payload. This is what's most important in career.

Best,
-Slashy

 

 

Edited February 26, 2016 by GoSlash27
